episodes.title: Leaving the LDS Church: Sally Dutton's Spiritual Awakening!
episodes.description:
From her upbringing in the LDS Church to a powerful spiritual awakening, Sally's story includes her vision to step away from organized religion and develop a personal relationship with God. 
While I believe in creating space for people to speak their truth, I want to clarify that this episode is not meant to promote any specific religious agenda. I may not share all of Sally's views, but I respect her right to share them. My hope is that listeners approach this conversation with openness, knowing that spiritual journeys are deeply individual, and there's no one size fits all path to your truth. 

In this episode, Sally Dutton shares her profound journey from growing up in the LDS church to experiencing a spiritual awakening that led her to publicly oppose church leadership. She emphasizes the significance of her developing a personal relationship with God beyond organized religion, encouraging others to embrace their spiritual journey and seek their own truth.
subjects: The Church Of Jesus Christ Of Latter-Day Saints

episodes.title: PART 2 From Witness to Warrior, Shannon's Story of Survival
episodes.description:
* CW this episode contains sensitive topics of abuse. Viewer discretion is advised.***Technical Disclaimer**
This episode may contain preliminary audio, visual, and editing elements, as we are still optimizing our production quality. We appreciate your understanding as we work to improve.

Episode 17 

PART 2 
Shannon Avery Briggs shares a profound journey of resilience through religious trauma, domestic violence and personal growth. She recounts her experiences with Jehovah's Witnesses, the challenges of an abusive relationship, her path to self discovery and healing. Shannon discusses the importance of seeking help, the impact of counselling, and her journey through cancer, ultimately leading to a deeper understanding of herself and her emotional health This conversation highlights the significance of community support and the ongoing journey of empowerment and recovery. Shannon's Book, Triumph over Darkness: My Journey  is available under recommended reads at www.awakentofreedom.ca  If you would like to work with Shannon,  please visit the professional resources page at www.awakentofreedom.ca

episodes.title: No Turning Back: Escaping Toxicity and Embracing Self-Love with Masako
episodes.description:
Episode 15
 **Technical Disclaimer**
This episode may contain preliminary audio, visual, and editing elements, as we are still optimizing our production quality. We appreciate your understanding as we work to improve.

What happens when the people who raised you are the ones you need to escape in order to heal? In this episode I sit down with Masako, a coach trained by Brandon Buchard, who shares her courageous journey from a deeply toxic childhood to becoming a fierce advocate for women's empowerment and personal transformation. This conversation is a love letter to anyone who has had to choose themselves over their family, who has wrestled with guilt and grief in the pursuit of healing, and who is learning that self love isn't selfish, it's survival.
If you would like to work with Masako, you can reach her through her Facebook page 

https://www.facebook.com/profile.php?id=100009228593803

If you are a woman who has a story to tell, and would like to be a guest on this podcast, visit www.awakentofreedom.ca

episodes.title: How to spot a Con Artist - What every woman should know before dating online - Shelly Galloway's Story
episodes.description:
* CW this episode contains sensitive topics of violence and abuse. Viewer discretion is advised.*
 **Technical Disclaimer**
This episode may contain preliminary audio, visual, and editing elements, as we are still optimizing our production quality. We appreciate your understanding as we work to improve.

Episode 14

Shelley shares her harrowing experience of being in a relationship with a con artist, detailing the emotional and physical abuse she endured. She recounts the challenges of uncovering the truth about her partner's deceitful life, the fear she lived in during their relationship, and the lengthy custody battle that followed the birth of their child. Shelley emphasizes the importance of vigilance in online dating and offers advice to other women to protect themselves from similar situations. Her story is one of resilience and hope, encouraging others to seek help and recognize the signs of manipulation and abuse.

episodes.title: From Haunted House to High Control Hell: Mandy's Cult Survival Story
episodes.description:
* CW this episode contains sensitive topics of suicide and abuse. Viewer discretion is advised.*
 **Technical Disclaimer**
This episode may contain preliminary audio, visual, and editing elements, as we are still optimizing our production quality. We appreciate your understanding as we work to improve.

Episode 12

In this powerful episode of Awakened to Freedom, host Jada interviews Mandy Valadez who shares her chilling journey into and out of the Potter's House Christian Fellowship, a high-control cult she unknowingly entered at just 16 after attending what seemed like a harmless Halloween haunted house. What followed was 17 years of deep psychological manipulation, spiritual abuse and isolation from the outside world. Mandy opens up about the insidious tactics used to control her mind, the fear based theology that kept her trapped and the moment she finally said enough. This conversation dives into the gritty realities of cult life, the trauma of waking up, and the courage it takes to rebuild your identity from the ground up. Whether you're a fellow survivor or simply curious about how someone can get pulled into and escape a religious cult, Mandy's story is a raw eye-opening and ultimately empowering ride. 
If you would like to work with Mandy, visit www.divine mandyoracle.com

episodes.title: PART 2  My Family Woke Me Up! How I left the Jehovah's Witness Organization - Deanna's Story
episodes.description:
Welcome to Episode 11
*CW This episode contains sensitive subjects and is for mature audiences.
 **Technical Disclaimer**
This episode may contain preliminary audio, visual, and editing elements, as we are still optimizing our production quality. We appreciate your understanding as we work to improve.

In PART 2 of this episode of Awaken to Freedom, host Jada interviews Deanna June from the Youtube Channel Just June https://youtube.com/@justdeannajune?si=Ckd4J3_z78PwhBzw
In this conversation, Deanna shares her personal journey of awakening from the Jehovah's Witnesses, detailing her struggles with alcoholism, mental health, and the impact of disfellowshipping. She reflects on her experiences in rehab, the dynamics within her family, and the gradual realization of the organization's issues. Deanna emphasizes the importance of self-discovery and the challenges faced in navigating life after rehab, including the dissolution of her congregation and the support (or lack thereof) from her community. In this conversation, she shares her personal journey of recovery from alcoholism, detailing her experiences with support (or lack thereof) from her congregation after rehab, the complexities of family dynamics, and the importance of finding the right recovery program. Deanna emphasizes the need for genuine encouragement and understanding in the recovery process, as well as the significance of being true to oneself after leaving a controlling organization. Deanna's story serves as an inspiration for others facing similar challenges, highlighting the diverse paths to healing and self-discovery.

Chapters
00:00 Awakening to Freedom: Introduction and Context
01:05 The Impact of Disfellowshipping and Public Reproval
02:47 Struggles with Alcoholism and Mental Health
06:13 The Journey Through Rehab and Family Dynamics
12:01 Confronting the Truth: Discovering the Reality of the Organization
17:50 Rehabilitation and Family Awakening
24:03 Navigating Life After Rehab and Congregational Changes
26:26 Navigating Support After Rehab

www.smartrecovery.org

episodes.title: My Family Woke Me Up! How I left the Jehovah's Witness Organization - Deanna's Story PART 1
episodes.description:
Welcome to Episode 10
*CW This episode contains sensitive subjects and is for mature audiences.
 **Technical Disclaimer**
This episode may contain preliminary audio, visual, and editing elements, as we are still optimizing our production quality. We appreciate your understanding as we work to improve.

Part 1
In this episode of Awakened to Freedom, host Jada interviews Deanna June from the Youtube Channel Just June https://youtube.com/@justdeannajune?si=Ckd4J3_z78PwhBzw
In this conversation, Deanna June shares her profound journey from being raised in the Jehovah's Witness organization to finding peace and sobriety after leaving. She discusses her traumatic childhood experiences, the challenges of growing up in a strict religious environment, and the impact of her father-in-law's dark legacy on her family. Deanna's story highlights the struggles of navigating life after leaving a high-control group and the importance of personal growth and healing. In this conversation, Deanna June shares her journey through creative aspirations, struggles with bipolar disorder, and the impact of alcohol on her life and family. She reflects on her early life, the introduction to alcohol, and the challenges of being a Jehovah's Witness, including the practice of disfellowshipping.

episodes.title: From Pain to Peace - Growing up in a cult environment -Jackie's Story
episodes.description:
Jada interviews Jackie Grillen, an expert in emotional trauma and abuse. Jackie shares her personal journey from pain to peace, detailing her childhood experiences, the impact of growing up in a household influenced by cult-like dynamics, and her struggles with identity and belonging. She discusses her path to healing through sobriety and her eventual transition into counseling and coaching, emphasizing the importance of integrating spirituality into the healing process. Jackie's story is one of resilience, empowerment, and the quest for personal freedom. In this conversation Jackie encourages listeners to embrace their unique paths and offers insights on personal growth and empowerment.

If you would like to work with Jackie, please email her at jackieinspires.com

episodes.title: Finding my freedom by leaving the Jehovah’s Witness organization - Angie’s story
episodes.description:
**Technical Disclaimer**
This episode may contain preliminary audio, visual, and editing elements, as we are still optimizing our production quality. We appreciate your understanding as we work to improve.

Welcome to Episode 8 In this inspiring conversation, Angie Watson shares her journey of resilience and empowerment after leaving the Jehovah's Witnesses. She discusses her struggles with cancer, the challenges of growing up in a high-control environment, and her determination to pursue education and help others. Angie emphasizes the importance of personal growth and offers words of encouragement for those seeking freedom from abusive relationships and controlling beliefs.

Angie is a dedicated trauma-informed counsellor with a Bachelor of Arts in Child and Youth Care and multiple diplomas in healthcare, social work, and counselling. Her professional journey is profoundly informed by her personal experiences, including her resilience in overcoming ovarian cancer, navigating a challenging, high-control religious upbringing, and enduring a 20-year abusive marriage. This unique perspective enables Angie to offer deep empathy and insight in her practice.

She specializes in providing mid-range psychotherapy for women who are on their healing journey from childhood abuse, sexual assault, and interpersonal violence. In addition to her counselling work, Angie is actively engaged in education and advocacy efforts to raise awareness and support those affected by violence. If you would like to contact or work with Angie please email
thestrengthwithin.u@ gmail.com

Chapters

01:47 Growing Up in a High-Control Environment
07:54 Breaking Free from the Jehovah's Witnesses

16:42 Facing Health Challenges and Education

episodes.title: Episode 7 Breaking the Cycle - Escaping Toxic Relationships - Bridget's Story
episodes.description:
*CW This episode contains sensitive subjects and is for mature audiences.
 **Technical Disclaimer**
This episode may contain preliminary audio, visual, and editing elements, as we are still optimizing our production quality. We appreciate your understanding as we work to improve.

Welcome to episode 7! 
In this episode of Awakened to Freedom, Jada interviews Bridget Pagna, who shares her harrowing journey through two toxic relationships marked by emotional and physical abuse. Bridget discusses the challenges she faced, the turning points that led her to leave, and her path to healing. She emphasizes the importance of recognizing the signs of abuse and the need for support systems for women in similar situations. Bridget also highlights her commitment to helping others escape domestic violence and the empowerment that comes from sharing one's story.

Bridget speaks of a charity that is close to her heart. In the UK, Refuge is a leading charity providing specialist support for women and children escaping domestic violence, offering safe accommodation, advocacy, and a 24/7 helpline. Visit their website at www.refuge.org.uk to donate today. 

If you or someone you know is trying to leave an abusive relationship, help is available. 
Below are emergency helpline numbers for women in Canada, the USA, and the UK who need immediate assistance:

Canada:
•  Assaulted Women’s Helpline: 1-866-863-0511 (24/7, available in up to 154 languages)
•  Hope for Wellness Helpline (for Indigenous people): 1-855-242-3310 (24/7, available in English, French, Cree, Ojibway, and Inuktitut)
•  Family Violence Info Line (Alberta): 310-1818 (24/7, call or text)
•  Kids Help Phone (for youth): 1-800-668-6868 (24/7)
•  Emergency: Call 911


USA:
•  National Domestic Violence Hotline: 1-800-799-SAFE (7233) (24/7)
•  Love Is Respect (for teens): 1-866-331-9474 (24/7)
•  Crisis Text Line: Text CONNECT to 741741 (24/7)
•  Emergency: Call 911

UK:
•  National Domestic Abuse Helpline (run by Refuge): 0808 2000 247 (24/7)
•  Women’s Aid Live Chat: Available Monday-Friday, 10am-10pm at www.nationaldahelpline.org.uk
•  Men’s Advice Line (for male victims): 0808 801 0327 (Monday-Friday, 10am-8pm)
•  National LGBT+ Domestic Abuse Helpline (run by Galop): 0800 999 5428 (Monday-Friday, 10am-5pm)
•  Emergency: Call 999 (if unable to speak, press 55 to signal for help)
You are not alone, and there is hope. Reach out for support and take the first step toward safety and healing.

episodes.title: Episode 6 - Reclaiming Identity: A New Life After Leaving the Jehovah's Witness Religion - Janelle's Story
episodes.description:
**Technical Disclaimer**
This episode may contain preliminary audio, visual, and editing elements, as we are still optimizing our production quality. We appreciate your understanding as we work to improve.

Welcome to Episode 6! In this episode of Awakened to Freedom, host Jada interviews Janelle Young, who shares her courageous journey of leaving a 22-year marriage and the Jehovah's Witness community after 45 years. Janelle discusses the challenges she faced, including losing her daughters and friends, the trauma of leaving, and the importance of self-discovery and healing. She emphasizes the need for support systems, therapy, and the strength to rebuild one's life. Janelle's story serves as an inspiration for others in similar situations, encouraging them to seek freedom and embrace their true selves.

If you are a woman who would like to share her story, and would like to be a guest on our podcast, visit www.awakentofreedom.ca

episodes.description:
**Technical Disclaimer**

Episode 5 is part 3 and the conclusion of Deanna Moore's story
If you haven't seen parts 1 and 2, you can watch here  

Watch part 1 https://youtu.be/YfxuGLphXFM?si=o7OB7ru58muBDecO

Watch part 2 https://youtu.be/Jj76hgu4hlI?si=34uCi7ILj2_7L_-D

In this conclusion, Deanna Moore shares her experiences and insights from conducting plant medicine retreats in Ecuador. She discusses the structure of the retreats, which include various plant medicines like psilocybin, ayahuasca, and San Pedro, and emphasizes the importance of personalized healing through NLP. Deanna highlights the intimate and safe environment she creates for participants, allowing for profound healing and transformation. She also shares her personal journey from struggle to success, encouraging listeners to invest in their healing and embrace the possibilities of life.
If you would like more information on the plant medicine retreats in Ecuador Deanna offers, you can email her at healingsoulsnlp@gmail.com

Welcome to Episode 3 of Awaken to Freedom Deanna Moore's Story
This episode is 1 of 3 parts. 
Deanna Moore shares her profound journey growing up in the Jehovah’s Witness organization, detailing her experiences of indoctrination, marriage, abuse, and the struggles of leaving the faith. She reflects on the psychological impact of her upbringing, the challenges of navigating relationships within the strict confines of the religion, and the journey of rebuilding her life after exiting the cult. Deanna emphasizes the importance of healing and the complexities of identity loss after leaving a high control group. In this episode, Deanna shares her tumultuous journey and challenges of being a Jehovah’s Witness and her eventual path to leaving. ￼

If you've ever felt trapped or are questioning the beliefs you’ve been taught, please consider subscribing. Each week I will upload a new interview and once a month I will have a guest who can provide help and insight into healing from trauma  Hit that like button, and join me on this journey - Let's awaken to freedom together.

episodes.title: Episode 2 From Abuse to Empowerment: Tammy's Story
episodes.description:
**Content Warning**
Please note that this episode contains topics of abuse and suicide. If you or anyone you know is having suicidal thoughts, please call or text 988. If you are in immediate danger, call 911.
 
***Technical Disclaimer***
This episode may contain preliminary audio, visual, and editing elements, as we are still optimizing our production quality. We appreciate your understanding as we work to improve.

Welcome to episode 2 of Awaken to Freedom.
In this powerful conversation, Tammy shares her harrowing journey of escaping a 15-year abusive relationship, the challenges she faced as a mother, and how she transformed her pain into empowerment through writing. She emphasizes the importance of seeking help and utilizing available resources for survivors of abuse, highlighting her own experiences and the support systems that aided her recovery. Tammy's story is one of resilience, healing, and the strength to rebuild one's life after trauma. 

Tammy is an award winning author. If you would like to check out her available books, click the links below

episodes.title: Episode 1 - My Story, why I left the Jehovah’s Witness Organization
episodes.description:
*****Content Warning - Viewer Discretion is Advised*****
Please note that this episode contains topics of abuse and suicide. If you or anyone you know is having suicidal thoughts, please call or text 988. If you are immediate danger please call 911. 

 
***Technical Disclaimer***
This episode may contain preliminary audio, visual, and editing elements, as we are still optimizing our production quality. We appreciate your understanding as we work to improve.


Welcome to the first episode of Awaken to Freedom! In this video, I'm sharing my story - how I broke free from a high control environment and took back my life. It's real and all about finding the courage to step into your own power. In this video, I sometimes weave in humor as I share my experience, approaching it with a touch of distance and lightness. It’s not about brushing aside the pain, but about carving out small moments of relief. This is a heavy, painful topic, so please know, I’m not here to downplay the trauma you might be experiencing or have experienced in the past.

If you've ever felt trapped or are questioning the beliefs you’ve been taught, please consider subscribing. Each week I will upload a new interview and once a month I will have a guest who can provide help and insight into healing from trauma  Hit that like button, and join me on this journey - Let's awaken to freedom together.
